files.description: Defines the tools package so the QA gate harness can be executed via python -m tools.pipeline.
Implements the one-command harness that runs init_outputs then validate_outputs, performs required artifact presence/minimal-completeness checks, and exits nonzero on any failure.
Provides reusable orchestration helpers for running pipeline stages deterministically, capturing failures, and producing a concise QA gate report/exit code.
Implements concrete checks for TRACKING_RECONCILIATION.md, Claim Cards, and QA gate artifacts including minimal completeness heuristics and canonical path handling.
Shell wrapper that invokes the canonical python QA gate command for local and CI usage with strict failure propagation.
CI workflow that runs the canonical QA gate command on pushes and pull requests and fails the build when required outputs/artifacts are missing or incomplete.
Documentation describing how to run the one-command QA gate locally and in CI, what artifacts it validates, and common failure modes.

missionDescription: Implement a one-command harness (e.g., scripts/run_pipeline.sh or python -m tools.pipeline) that runs init_outputs + validate_outputs and exits nonzero on failure; ensure it checks for the presence and minimal completeness of TRACKING_RECONCILIATION.md, Claim Cards, and QA gate artifacts.
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete strategic task identified by Meta-Coordinator or escalated by Strategic Tracker

Curated insight (actionability 8-9/10): Automates enforcement: a single command/script that generates scaffolds and validates expected /outputs files makes compliance repeatable and reduces drift between documented process and actual reposi...
